intro: Pouteria kemoensis, commonly known as the Kemo emerald fruit, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapotaceae. It is native to the rainforests of South America, particularly in regions of Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy leaves and produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. The fruit has a thick, leathery skin and contains a single, large seed. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
